alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 12:12AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream and creeks flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams with some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Piscataquis County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
